statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: GOLDEN BEAR CLASSIC AT BERKELEY CA

article.headline: Bucknell 61, Long Beach St. 57
article.story: BERKELEY, Calif. (AP) -- John Griffin had 15 points and Josh Linthicum scored off a pair of offensive rebounds in the final 70 seconds to lead Bucknell to a 61-57 win over Long Beach State in the consolation game of the Golden Bear Classic on Saturday night. G.W. Boon and Justin Castleberry added 12 points apiece for the Bison (5-7), who had lost seven of nine before holding off a late run by the 49ers thanks to the work on the boards by Linthicum. Coming off a season-high 18 points in Bucknell's loss to North Dakota State a night earlier, Linthicum scored six straight points in the final 2:30 minutes against Long Beach State, getting four off offensive rebounds. His putback of a Castleberry missed jumper in the lane gave the Bison a 59-55 lead with 29 seconds left to play. Linthicum finished with nine points and a career-high 12 rebounds. Cornell Williams made a short jumper in the key to pull the 49ers within 59-57 but Castleberry sank two free throws with nine seconds remaining to seal the win. Donovan Morris scored 19 of his career-high 27 points in the second half but it wasn't enough for the 49ers, who shot just 20.8 percent in the first half and finished the game 19 of 52 (36.5 percent). Greg Plater added 13 points and three assists while Williams had 11 rebounds.
